title: Fed's Goolsbee sees 'golden path' to lower inflation without a recession
description: Goolsbee said he's confident inflation can be tamed without a recession, even with additional rate increases likely.

title: Twitter's desktop app sees surge in outages as Meta's Threads takes off
description: Numerous users of Twitter's desktop app reported outages on Friday while rival Threads recorded 70 million signups.

title: What Apple's big bet on India means for the tech giant's future
description: Apple's plan to move more iPhone manufacturing from China to India sounds like a good idea on paper. In the real world, it's plagued with serious challenges

title: Meta's Twitter rival Threads explodes to 70 million signups one day after launch
description: The text-based social media product already has 70 million sign-ups, Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg said on Friday.

title: 'We are in uncharted territory': World records hottest day ever for the third time in just four days
description: The extraordinary feat comes shortly after the European Union's climate change service confirmed the planet observed its hottest June on record.

title: Ford ends an era as the last Fiesta rolls off the production line
description: The vehicle was a mainstay of millions of drivers around the world.

title: Payrolls rose by 209,000 in June, less than expected, as jobs growth wobbles
description: Nonfarm payrolls were expected to increase by 240,000 and the unemployment rate to fall to 3.6% in June.

title: China hits Alibaba affiliate Ant Group with $985 million fine for violating various regulations
description: China's central bank hit Alibaba affiliate Ant Group with a 7.12 billion yuan fine ($985 million) on Friday.

title: The No. 1 way to grow your wealth, according to a self-made millionaire: It’s ‘deceptively simple’
description: Growing your wealth should be boring, Ramit Sethi says. He shares three strategies that allow you to grow your money long-term.

title: Britain's house prices are slumping as mortgage rates soar — and there could be worse to come
description: U.K. house prices fell at their fastest annual pace in 12 years in June as still escalating mortgage costs piled further pressure on the property market.

title: Alibaba launches A.I. tool to generate images from text
description: Chinese technology giant Alibaba on Friday launched Tongyi Wanxiang, an artificial intelligence tool that can generate images from prompts.

title: Japanese pharma Eisai slides 4% despite FDA approval for Alzheimer's drug
description: Leqembi is the first Alzheimer's antibody treatment to receive full FDA approval.

title: 'We would not stand idly by': Lagarde pledges ECB action if both profits and wages rise
description: There are concerns that some companies are increasing their prices more than is needed to compensate for higher costs, thereby boosting their profit margins.

title: U.S. Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen meets Chinese Premier Li Qiang
description: "The United States will, in certain circumstances, need to pursue targeted actions to protect its national security," U.S. Treasury Secretary Yellen said.

title: Yellen says she's 'concerned' about China's new export controls in her first public remarks in Beijing
description: Starting Aug. 1, companies in China that want to export two metals used in semiconductor manufacturing would need to apply for licenses.

title: Yellen's visit to China is 'crucial' to U.S.-China engagement, professor says
description: Janet Yellen's visit to China is "crucial" to ensuring that both countries continue talking to each other, said Eswar Prasad of Cornell University.

title: Germany's economy is stagnating. And these 5 charts show how
description: A faltering gross domestic product isn't the only figure that suggests tthe German economy is stuttering.

title: Sri Lanka's central bank says more rate cuts are needed for economy to 'bounce back'
description: "We should need further reduction in interest rates on the basis of forward-looking inflation, forward-looking output gap," the central bank's governor Nandalal Weerasinghe said.

title: Samsung estimates profits plunged 96% in the second quarter
description: Companies are grappling with excess chip inventories as consumers buy fewer electronics due to inflation. As a result, prices for memory chips have fallen.

title: Zoom is 'extremely optimistic' about growth in Asia-Pacific despite weaker outlook
description: Zoom is "doubling down" on its technical investments in the Asia-Pacific region as it seeks to strengthen growth, said the video communications company.

title: Potential Taiwan conflict will hit these 3 countries the hardest, EIU report says
description: To be clear, the EIU assesses the risk of a direct Chinese military assault on Taiwan as "very unlikely."

title: A 'nice' workplace culture may be more toxic than you think, says this NYU professor
description: "There's this false dichotomy of: If you're critical, that means you are toxic ... But nice isn't always better. Sometimes nice is a cop out," said Tessa West.
